topics.body:
"@someguy111":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53688be56368727064180000#post_53688be56368727064180000
The reliability of that article is zero. First of all, citing NaturalNews causes an instant loss in credibility, since NN also promotes anti-vaccine hysteria, 9/11 conspiracy theories and MH370 conspiracy theories, among other crazy stuff. Also, the statement of the American Academy of Environmental Medicine flies in the face of statements by the World Health Organization and most other medical organizations, which say there is no evidence GMO crops are dangerous.

topics.body:
"@Randomosaur":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53688d6d6368724ee2fd0100#post_53688d6d6368724ee2fd0100
Uh huh. And you don't think your "evidence' comes from "research" done by large companies? There was a study conducted by tobacco companies that said smoking was not a health issue and a study done by oil companies that said climate change is a myth. Keep in mind when large companies present data it is often biased and obscured data generated to protect the company and it's profits.

"@someguy111":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53688ee56368721ce3b60000#post_53688ee56368721ce3b60000
Again, "safety studies with independent funding.":http://www.biofortified.org/genera/studies-for-genera/independent-funding/ They exist. Also, the nutrition paper on Golden Rice was independent too. Golden Rice isn't owned by a large company like Monsanto anyway, it is public, not corporate. You seem to miss that point. Not to mention that unlike Monsanto's seeds, Golden Rice seeds are allowed to be kept and replanted, so no money is made from lawsuits.

Just curious, do you believe other things that NaturalNews says as well?

Please my little student, tell me more.

I should be going to bed right about now, in fact I already should be asleep, but I'll leave tonight with one last random cool science thing.  You know how for years scientists have been trying to understand dolphin language?  They made a major breakthrough with translating the first word in dolphin's language.
